sections.name: Nightwood Guardian
Rare Gentleness
sections.text: Though most encounters with nightwood guardians end in violence, the Plane of Wood has many folktales about these giant creatures escorting youngsters lost in the nightwoods safely out of the darkness. Whether these stories are true or wishful thinking is debated, with some arguing that a nightwood guardian would only perform such a kindness on the orders of another creature

The nightwoods are parts of the Plane of Wood permanently bathed in darkness due to an absence of fluorescent plants. Here, the flora and fauna require darkness, not light, to thrive. Troll-like creatures known as nightwood guardians patrol these woods to ensure they remain in perpetual shadow. Considering themselves righteous gardens, they care little for the excuses of anyone else—intruders or residents. The guardians absolutely loathe the light, though it doesn't harm them as it does some varieties of creatures. Though wary of both light and any interloping lifeforms in their natural habitat, a nightwood guardian's fear turns easily to wrath, making the guardian a force of fury who seeks to drive out intruders.  
  
***Unspecific Lore***: DC 26  
***Specific Lore***: DC 23

traits.name: Uncommon
traits.text: Something of uncommon rarity requires special training or comes from a particular culture or part of the world. Some character choices give access to uncommon options, and the GM can choose to allow access for anyone. Less is known about uncommon creatures than common creatures. They typically can't be summoned. The DC of Recall Knowledge checks related to these creature is increased by 2.

traits.name: Troll
traits.text: Trolls are giant, brutish creatures and are well known for their ability to regenerate.

traits.name: Wood
traits.text: Effects with the wood trait conjure or manipulate wood. Those that manipulate wood have no effect in an area without wood. Creatures with this trait consist primarily of wood or have a connection to magical wood.

automatic_abilities.name: Fire-fueled Rage
automatic_abilities.text: When a nightwood guardian takes fire damage, they become enraged. The guardian gains 15 temporary Hit Points, deals 2 additional damage with melee Strikes, and has a –1 penalty to AC. They can't Raise their Shield or use actions with the concentrate trait except for Seek. This effect ends when the nightwood guardian no longer observes any fire for 1 round or when they fall unconscious, whichever comes first.

automatic_abilities.name: Flesh of Wood

traits.name: Primal
traits.text: This magic comes from the primal tradition, connecting to the natural world and instinct. Anything with this trait is magical.

traits.name: Wood
traits.text: Effects with the wood trait conjure or manipulate wood. Those that manipulate wood have no effect in an area without wood. Creatures with this trait consist primarily of wood or have a connection to magical wood.

automatic_abilities.text: Wounds inflicted on a nightwood guardian turn their flesh to wood. When the guardian is reduced to 40 HP or fewer, their body becomes solid wood. They are stunned, have resistance 10 to all damage, and have regeneration 40 (deactivated by fire). This ends once the guardian has 100 HP or more, though they can choose to stay in this form indefinitely.

automatic_abilities.name: Shield Eyes
automatic_abilities.text: When a nightwood guardian has their shield raised, they protect their eyes, losing the blinded and dazzled conditions from light blindness and other light effects.

traits.name: Reach
traits.text: Natural attacks with this trait can be used to attack creatures up to the listed distance away instead of only adjacent creatures. Weapons with this trait are long and can be used to attack creatures up to 10 feet away instead of only adjacent creatures. For creatures that already have reach with the limb or limbs that wield the weapon, the weapon increases their reach by 5 feet.

traits.name: Reach
traits.text: Natural attacks with this trait can be used to attack creatures up to the listed distance away instead of only adjacent creatures. Weapons with this trait are long and can be used to attack creatures up to 10 feet away instead of only adjacent creatures. For creatures that already have reach with the limb or limbs that wield the weapon, the weapon increases their reach by 5 feet.

ability.name: Nightwood Roar

traits.name: Concentrate
traits.text: An action with this trait requires a degree of mental concentration and discipline.

traits.name: Darkness
traits.text: Darkness effects extinguish non-magical light in the area, and can counteract less powerful magical light. You must usually target light magic with your darkness magic directly to counteract the light, but some darkness spells automatically attempt to counteract light.

traits.name: Primal
traits.text: This magic comes from the primal tradition, connecting to the natural world and instinct. Anything with this trait is magical.

ability.effect: The guardian roars, snuffing out lights in a 30-foot cone. Ordinary flames and lights are extinguished, and the guardian attempts to counteract any magical light with a +21 counteract modifier and a counteract rank of 5.
